Lists Demonstration

Simple Bullet List

First bullet point

Second bullet point

Third bullet point

Fourth bullet point

Multi-level Bullet List

Main topic one

Subtopic 1.1

Subtopic 1.2

Sub-subtopic 1.2.1

Sub-subtopic 1.2.2

Main topic two

Subtopic 2.1

Simple Numbered List (Decimal)

First numbered item

Second numbered item

Third numbered item

Fourth numbered item

Multi-level Numbered List (6 Levels Deep)

Level 1 - Main section (1.)

Level 2 - Subsection (1.1.)

Level 3 - Sub-subsection (1.1.1.)

Level 4 - Detailed point (1.1.1.1.)

Level 5 - Fine detail (1.1.1.1.1.)

Level 6 - Finest detail (1.1.1.1.1.1.)

Level 5 - Another fine detail (1.1.1.1.2.)

Level 4 - Another detailed point (1.1.1.2.)

Level 3 - Another sub-subsection (1.1.2.)

Level 2 - Another subsection (1.2.)

Level 1 - Second main section (2.)

Level 2 - Its subsection (2.1.)

Level 3 - Its sub-subsection (2.1.1.)

Level 1 - Third main section (3.)

Roman Numerals List (6 Levels Deep)

Alternating upper and lower case Roman numerals at each level:

Level 1 - Upper Roman (I.)

Level 2 - Lower Roman (i.)

Level 3 - Upper Roman (I.)

Level 4 - Lower Roman (i.)

Level 5 - Upper Roman (I.)

Level 6 - Lower Roman (i.)

Level 6 - Lower Roman (ii.)

Level 5 - Upper Roman (II.)

Level 4 - Lower Roman (ii.)

Level 3 - Upper Roman (II.)

Level 2 - Lower Roman (ii.)

Level 1 - Upper Roman (II.)

Level 2 - Lower Roman (i.)

Level 1 - Upper Roman (III.)

Level 1 - Upper Roman (IV.)

Letter-based List (6 Levels Deep)

Alternating upper and lower case letters at each level:

Level 1 - Upper case letter (A.)

Level 2 - Lower case letter (a.)

Level 3 - Upper case letter (A.)

Level 4 - Lower case letter (a.)

Level 5 - Upper case letter (A.)

Level 6 - Lower case letter (a.)

Level 6 - Lower case letter (b.)

Level 6 - Lower case letter (c.)

Level 5 - Upper case letter (B.)

Level 6 - Lower case letter (a.)

Level 4 - Lower case letter (b.)

Level 3 - Upper case letter (B.)

Level 2 - Lower case letter (b.)

Level 1 - Upper case letter (B.)

Level 2 - Lower case letter (a.)

Level 1 - Upper case letter (C.)

Key Points About Lists

Each numbering reference creates an independent list

Same reference continues numbering, different reference restarts

Levels create hierarchical structure (0 = main, 1 = sub, 2 = sub-sub)

Indentation is controlled by left and hanging indent values

Always use LevelFormat constants (BULLET, DECIMAL, UPPER_ROMAN, LOWER_LETTER, etc.)
